p: Members of the Phenuiviridae family contain a trisegmented single-stranded RNA genome of negative or ambisense polarity, encoding 5 or 6 proteins ( 20, 21). The 3 genomic RNA segments are designated the large (L), medium (M), and small (S) segments. The L segment encodes the viral RNA-dependent RNA polymerase, the M segment encodes the 2 viral envelope glycoproteins (Gn and Gc), and the S segment encodes the nucleocapsid protein (N) and a nonstructural protein (NSs) in an ambisense manner ( 22).
